intro: Laserpitium chironium, commonly known as the yellow scabious, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caprifoliaceae. It is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in dry meadows and grasslands. The plant features slender, erect stems and produces clusters of small, yellowish or white flowers. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a rough texture. It is valued in gardens for its attractive flowers and ability to attract pollinators.
